item.description:
For all of those who are interested in gardening as much as I am, there will be a workshop in the heart of Federal Hill focused upon container gardening. 

Here are the details:

Rent your apartment? Surrounded by concrete? You don’t need a yard to be a gardener! You can still grow herbs and even vegetables in pots, hanging baskets, and other containers, on balconies or in windows. Learn how when you join us for a “horticultural happy hour” at our Container Gardening workshop on Wednesday, June 29th, 5:30-7:00 p.m. at 9 Hammond St. on the city’s west side (near the corner of Bridgham and Westminster St.). You’ll find out which plants do well in small spaces and which don’t and get inspired to design some creative containers of your own.


IMPORTANT:  Go the following website:

http://plantprovidence.wordpress.com/2011/06/02/more-free-workshops/

Be sure to scroll to the top of the webpage and click "Register for a Workshop."  After you have registered, then go ahead and RSVP to the event here on MeetUp.  There is NO COST to this event.

 

After 7 pm, if anyone is interested, we'll go to a local watering hole afterwards that is decided upon amongst the group at the event.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be sporting a "Penn State" shirt ...
item.name: Container Gardening
